text: a nuclear missile exploded at the New
Jersey Air Force Base in 1960 the Boeing
CI m10 beaumart was a supersonic
long-range surface-to-air missile
developed during the Cold War the
missile could be outfitted with standard
explosive or nuclear warheads one of the
sights outfitted with the missiles was
bomarc base number one a 218 acre
missile launch complex located in Fort
Dix on June 7th 1960 he leaned tank on
one of the missiles exploded causing the
fuel tank to explode and creating a
massive fire in launcher shelter 204
however the nuclear warheads did not
explode but it did melt and some
radioactive material accumulated on the
floor or was washed away by the water
used to battle the fire concrete and
asphalt were spread on the surrounding
soil and other contaminated area and the
destroyed shelter was fenced off and
never rebuilt a nuclear response team
inspected the surrounding 66 miles and
didn't find any trace of dispersed
radiation however about 10 and a half
ounces of weapons-grade plutonium was
not recovered the base closed in 1972 in
2002 the military began destroying the
shelter and removing soil as they
discovered traces of plutonium around
the site the soil was shipped by rail to
a disposal site in Utah and the Air
Force now caused the suck radioactive
waste zero
